fossilTypes.title: Plants
fossilTypes.body: 1. Poplar Leaf (45-50 MYA) Green River Formation, Utah | 2a. Polished Chert, vascular plant mater (410 MYA) Rhynie, Scotland | 2b. Algae (440 MYA) Kalana Quarry, Estonia | 3. Petrified Sequoia Wood Bookends | 4. Lycopod Tree Root (310MYA), Oklahoma | 5. Syringodendron (300 MYA) Summersville Coal Mine, West Virginia | 6. Calamites (300 MYA) Summersville Coal Mine, West Virginia

fossilTypes.title: Marine Animals
fossilTypes.body: 1a. Oyster Morocco | 1b. Oyster Peru | 2. Crinoid | 3. Misc. Devonian Fossils (350-400 MYA) Buffalo & Darien, NY | 4. Megalodon Tooth | 5. Hybodus Dorsal Spine (95 MYA) Kem Kem Basin, Morocco | 6. Plesiosaur Tooth with associated fish bones (65-100 MYA) Morocco | 7. Crocodile Skull Fragment (95 MYA) Kem Kem Basin, Morocco | 8. Mosasaur Vertebrae (80 MYA) Kansas

fossilTypes.title: Trace Fossils
fossilTypes.body: 1. Microbial Mat (300 MYA) Oklahoma | 2. Stromatolite (2 BYA) Western Australia | 3. Tiger Iron Stromatolite (2.7 BYA) Pilbara, Australia | 4. Strelley Pool Stromatolite (3.4 BYA) Pilbara, Australia | 5. Reptile Tail Print (50 MYA), Utah

fossilTypes.title: Mammals
fossilTypes.body: 1. Glyptodon Scute (11,000 - 2.6 MYA) Florida | 2. Deer Antler (???) Florida | 3. Running Rhino Jaw Fragment (32 MYA) South Dakota | 4. Cave Bear Tooth (11,000 - 2.6 MYA) Russia | 5. Brontotherium Vertebra (30-50 MYA) South Dakota | 6. Oreodont Jaw (30-50 MYA) South Dakota | 7. Wooly Mammoth Foot Bone (11,000 - 2.6 MYA) Alaska???

fossilTypes.title: Dinosaurs
fossilTypes.body: 1. Polished Iguanadon Vertebra Cross-Section (125 MYA) Isle of Wight, UK | 2. Unidentified Sauropod Scute | 3. Triceratops Tooth (66 MYA) Montana | 4. Unidentified Tyrannosaur Tooth Fragment (70 MYA) Montana | 5. Spinosaurus Tooth (97-112 MYA) Kem Kem Basin, Morocco | 6. Ornithomimus Claw (70 MYA) Montana | 7-8. Edmontosaurus Jaw Section (66 MYA) Montana | 9. Triceratops Head Shield Fragment (66 MYA) South Dakota | 10-11. Ankylosaur Scute (70 MYA) Montana | 12. Diplodocus Tail Vertebra (150 MYA) Wyoming | 13. Triceratops Rib Segment (66 MYA) South Dakota
